DOC.brief_summary: This research project aim assess effectiveness impact pediatric-based intervention aim reduce low-income family ' unmet material need ( food , housing , employment , childcare , household heat , education learn English language ) child health .
DOC.brief_title: Reducing Socioeconomic Disparities Health Pediatric Visits
DOC.detailed_description: This project build upon PI 's prior study include recently complete cluster RCT community health center Boston , demonstrate positive impact provider referral , discussion , family receipt resource . This study specifically test effectiveness strengthen intervention `` WE CARE 2.0 '' provider referral family receipt resource , along impact child health , health care utilization , developmental outcomes . Finally , gather information stakeholder health center order learn facilitator barrier implementation model . The study take place six community health center Greater Boston area . The center randomize either intervention control site . Data collect referral , receipt resource , child outcome child 's electronic medical record ( EMR ) birth age 3 . Focus group use gather implementation data intervention health center personnel . The WE CARE 2.0 intervention consist : 1 ) WE CARE survey parent complete prior child 's well-child visit ; 2 ) information technology ( IT ) generate provider referral provider use provide family resource information sheet ; 3 ) peer patient navigator assist family connect available resource update provider ; 4 ) training session provider office staff . Families attend control health center receive standard care . Of note , since health center share common EMR ethical reason , control sit access IT generate referral mechanism .
DOC.criteria: Child Medicaid insurance Is attend routine newborn visit Premature ( less equal 32 week GA ) Has chronic disease Has Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome Has foster parent
